Ah Lucky Star, the show about absolutely nothing that I have for some reason sat through 12 times. Why you ask? Allow me to explain. Now most people will instantly say "Drop that moe Garbage", however, this show has a certain charm to it. I won't go into extreme detail however, this show always has me coming back. Between the constant KyoAni references to their other works (the melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya and some Full Metal Panic!) and other popular shows in general, this show almost has something for everyone. I keep finding myself enjoying it more and more each and every time because eachtime I watch, I am more knowledgeable of stuff it references. Other than the plot just consisting of generic moe cute girls doing cute things, the show is really enjoyable and has a fun cast of characters.

Lucky ☆ Star is a very unique anime. And it provided a very pleasantly unique experience! I don't really understand why I love this anime so much, it could be because of the artwork, which I personally find appealing. It has that cheery, happy feeling that you don't often get in anime. When I watch Lucky ☆ Star, it always leaves me feeling very happy!
But though all the greatness of this, I still have minor issues. I don't mind the storyline not having much development, because that is one of the big characteristics that makes this anime unique, but I dislike the fact that thereis only a small amount of character development. For me, if this anime had romance in it, I would have rated it a full 10 marks. But that is the ONLY thing that let it down for me.


I love this anime though, with all my heart. I also believe that you can watch this anime again, and again, and again. That is the amazing factor that the storyline brings.


Anyway, I recommend this anime to anyone, not just because it is awesome, but because Konata Izumi is AWESOME. :D

Lucky Star at a glance is a typical SoL anime about a group of junior high-school girls that makes tons of references and jokes about other anime and manga such as Gundam, Pokemon, and Sgt. Frog. It has a very light-hearted but also comedic aspect behind it which I find people either loving it or hating it.
Story 3/10
Its not that the story was bad its the lack of one. SoL's are normally like this so I'm not real to fed up with this at all. Each episode entails of mostly random conversations between the main cast of characters and really minor sub-plots. The main focusis directed towards the comedy than anything else. It makes a fine work of making you laugh. I don't think there was an episode where I didn't laugh at some point.


Art 8/10

The art style was pretty solid overall. They made fine work of taking you across a few different titles art styles which I found pretty cool. Its not everyday you see a shift in style in an anime so it was pretty refreshing to see that. The character design was very well done. I enjoyed every character in terms of design very kawaii for the most part.


Sound 10/10

This is one of the best OST's I have ever heard. For starters, the OP was drop dead amazing and very catchy. Episode 1-14 always featured the cast of characters singing a random song at the end of each episode. I found that very cute as always. The rest had a live action ED which was so hilarious. I could not stop laughing at the end of each episode. Totally something I wish I had a CD for.


Character 9/10

The main four girls of the series can be related to if you watch a lot of anime or manga. The confection between audience and character was made to grab your attention from the start and thats something a lot of writers aren't good at but this series in particular has done a fine job with that. I felt right at home when watching the interactions between them. Though as with story, there was hardly any character development.


Overall 9/10

This was a very good series but this is not something you should try to marathon. While I am going against myself here this anime has a casual feel and is meant to be enjoyed when you need a fresh relief from reality and a good laugh now and then. It is also very much so good to watch with friends as I did. I highly recommend it to anyone willing to take a break from very action packed shounens and such anime.

Lucky Star is known as the Anime that makes no sense at all. It's said that it is an Anime about noting and still, it has a really high fanbase. Why is that?
Story: Well...it is really hard to score this for Lucky Star, since the only story there is, is some girls going to school. There is no real plot, but only random scenes out of the life of the main characters. There is no drama, no death, only comedy. Nothing else.
?/10
Characters: This is just as hard to score, but this time I will give it a try. The characters are the typical characters fora moe-show. There is the crazy one, the agressive one, the smart one and the clumsy one and all of them are cute.

We have Izumi Konata. She is the typical lazy Otaku, playing Light Novel, MMOs, console games, reading Manga and watching Anime. She has a really sarcastic humor and is the main idsentification of the show.

Hiragi Tsukasa is the clumsy one of the whole group. She breaks everything and is neither smart nor gifted in anything but being cute.

Hiragi Kagami is the contrary to here twin sister Tsukasa. She is really good in school since she is studying a lot and gets angry quickly.

Takara Miyuki is the smart one. She is really clever and knows almost everything. Still she is almost as clumsy as Tsukasa and just as kind.

6/10


Art: Lucky Star has been produced by Kyoto Animation, who had many major works, such as the almost every key adaption (Clannad, Air, Kannon 2006), K-on and the Haruhi Suzumiya franchise. The style of the show is really moe. The girls who are supposed to be 17 look as if they were still in elementary school and even the mature ones look this way. The Animation is quite good, given that this is a slice of life comedy Anime.

7/10


Sound: The sound is ok. The Soundtrack has nothing special in particular. The Opening though is even if it is really annoying one of the most addicting ones ever and I found myself listening to only this song for over an hour. The ending on the other hand is not definable, since it always is diferent and always for the purpose of comedy (sometimes it really is incredibly hillarious)

7/10


personal enjoyment: This Anime is hillarious. That's why has that much of a fanbase. It basically has no plot and no sense, but the comedy is so well done that you just have to laugh out loud. It has one problem though, and that is nothing that really gets the score down, but something that might be annoying to some. To be able to watch Lucky Star, you should have seen the whole Haruhi Suzumiya franchise (except movie), since there are so many references about it that it actually will be a lot less funny if you don't know it. Of course there are other Otaku references too, but not as siginifcant as this.

10/10


I LOVE THIS ANIME. It's official now. Lucky Star is incredibly funny, but has too many flaws to really give it full points. The plot is nothing that really is missing and I love the fact that it doesn't take Anime seriously at all. The Anime is done for those Otaku's who actually know a lot about the Otaku scene.

In total: 8/10

Critic's Log - Earthdate: March 17, 2013. Review #41: Lucky Star
*I Breathe in and sigh heavily* I was afraid this day would come... Let's get this over with... Here's... *Sigh*  Lucky Star...
Lucky Star is about the lives of several school girls attending a Japanese high school. The main heroine is Konata Izumi, an athletic and intelligent girl who, despite these attributes, is not in a sports club, and her grades remain low. Her laziness at school is due to her enthusiasm for anime and video games, and she is not interested in anything else much.
... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...... ... ... Yeah, that's the plot *Sigh* We're screwed.






To be technical, this is a Kyoto Animation production and they were known for their high production values especially with a popular anime such as The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya. For Lucky Star being a comedy, the art style is intentional and I can honestly say that the character designs do look good. The character designs are both colorful and cute. I know it's odd that I'm saying this but it's true. It is kinda odd that these high school students look like middle school students. The animation is nice but not perfect.






The music by Satoru Kousaki is kind of forgettable and that's all I can say about this topic.








When it comes to voice acting, the Japanese cast is terrific and really makes the voices sound fitting. Aya Hirano is terrific as Konata, Emiri Kato is great as Kagami, Kaori Fukuhara is also great as Tsukasa, and Aya Endo is also great as Miyuki. The standout extras in the subbed version include Fumihiko Tachiki which he got to have 62 minor roles in this show. Damn, why so many!? Jouji Nakata, Minoru Shiraishi as Minoru Shiraishi, Tomokazu Seki as Meito Anisawa and Hiromi Konno as Akira Kogami. On the English Dub side, Wendee Lee was chosen to play Konata because of the fact that Aya Hirano plays both Haruhi Suzumiya and Konata Izumi and Wendee Lee does play the nerdy girl type extremely well but I think Hirano-san perfected the role. Wendee Lee is great as Konata. Kari Wahlgren is terrific as Kagami, Karen Strassman is great as Miyuki, and Michelle Ruff is pretty good as Tsukasa. The standout extras in the dub include Kate Higgens as Miss Kuroi, Stephanie Sheh as Akira Kogami, Lex Lang as Meito Anisawa, Derek Stephen Prince and Richard Epcar for both having more than 25 roles in the same show...Damn! To be honest, if you want to have a more fitting version in cultural settings, go with the subs on this one.








When it comes to characters, the characters are very memorable but don't expect character development for any of these characters but since this anime has the spirit of a sitcom. Sitcoms don't specialize in character development so I wasn't expecting this much on Lucky Star. I hope my analogy of Lucky Star and sitcoms made sense.






When it comes to plot...te he he... what plot? ha ha ha, THERE'S NO DAMN PLOT TO THIS SHOW! IT'S JUST A BUNCH OF HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS TALKING ABOUT CERTAIN TOPICS! Again, sitcoms have this kind of formula but there are times when an episode is boring as hell. The first episode may have been a cute starter but it was hardly funny. Gee, NICE FIRST IMPRESSION STAFF! NICE FIRST IMPRESSION! To be honest, the approach is giving the show a familiar environment for the viewer that is very common in schools. High school students just talking about random shit, that's pretty damn basic. The show does have an aimless plot for having no plot at all whatsoever. This can be Lucky Star's biggest turn-off factors in the show. The thing is... We all have our own groups and have our own conversations, we kinda see what Lucky Star was trying to invoke with that similar approach, but I had a hard time liking Lucky Star because of its slow pacing and dialogue. Another turn-off factor could be that IT'S MOSTLY INVOLVES PEOPLE TALKING. Also, the "Lucky Channel" segments are ok but I found some of the segments a little pointless. Putting all that ranting aside, some of the jokes aren't bad and Lucky Star has a cutesy appeal. Is this show really all that bad? That would all depend on what you're interested in I guess. Is Lucky Star worth seeing? In all honesty... Yes! I am under the assumption that this is a show that is giving Anime fans a tribute because of their enthusiasm towards Anime. Could Lucky Star be a little shorter than what it is? I guess. Is Lucky Star overrated? That's for you to decide. I personally felt that Lucky Star to me was kind of a test on patience, there were times when I was bored while watching it and I'm not the only one that said it was a boring show. Some people even say it's overrated... Well, NO SHIT! I have seen shows that were funnier than this half-funny and half-boring show. I am better off watching The Blues Brothers after watching Lucky Star, I am better off playing video games like Zelda, Mario, and Final Fantasy. I'm better off watching Hetalia more than once instead of watching Lucky Star more than once. AANNNNDD! I AM BETTER OFF WATCHING MY LITTLE PONY: FRIENDSHIP IS MAGIC COUNTLESS TIMES WITHOUT GETTING BORED THAN WATCHING LUCKY STAR COUNTLESS TIMES AND GETTING BORED!!! I'M THE FULLMETAL COWBOY AND I'M GOING OUT TO THE CHINESE RESTAURANT NEAR WHERE I LIVE THAT IS ALSO CALLED "LUCKY STAR" SO I CAN FORGET THAT I WATCHED THE ENTIRETY OF LUCKY STAR! I GOT MORE BETTER THINGS TO DO THAN RE-WATCH THIS!!!


Whew, I also need to take my medication. My apologies. Allow me to re-phrase that. Lucky Star does deserve to been seen. If you want to watch the whole thing, be my guest. This is an anime that I think should be seen but has that "Once is enough" watch value, whether it's an episode, or the entire show.




Lucky Star was available by Bandai Entertainment, it is out of print. The manga by Kagami Yoshimizu was also available by Bandai Entertainment and is also out of print. There has not been an American release to any Lucky Star video game to this day. The light novel series also never came stateside. A manga called "Lucky Star Pocket Travelers" never was released stateside. A spinoff called "Miyakawa-ke no Kūfuku" has not been released in the U.S. A spinoff light novel series called "Yuruyuru Days" has not been released in the U.S. either. A Lucky Star OVA however was released stateside, but unfortunately...It was licensed by Bandai Entertainment, meaning...that too is out of print.




With all that said, Lucky Star is an anime that might not hold up to everyone's expectations. It does have cutesy character designs, it does have some funny moments, and some memorable characters. It does have an aimless plot (which I'll give the staff a pass for this) but the music is forgettable and is often boring at times or maybe an entire episode. The animation however isn't really all that terrible.




I give Lucky Star a 5.9 out of 10, it is SO and SO!




Feel free to comment below, now if you'll excuse me... I got some fun stuff to do, and that information is all classified. Actually, it isn't. Bye-nee!

WOW! What I write about this anime isn't going to do it justice. 
It's a funny realistic slice of life. The characters are relatable and highly amusing. Whilst watching this anime, I felt as if I was reliving my high school years. 
I think the fact that there isn't a very focused plot line (just loosely follows the characters through their years at school), makes this anime what it is. Alot of people have a problem, when there's no goal to reach by the end of the series, but I think this anime superbly displays that you don't need a specific story to have agreat show, just everday life is enough! 


The art work is adorable, but bright and funky at the same time. The OST's whilst simple, work really well within the anime, they perfectly reflect the characters personalities and the situation at hand. 


I have watched the series twice and certain episodes three or four times, and it just doesn't get old. I honestly don't laugh out loud at that many animes, but this one got me chuckling. 


I highly recommend this anime, I know alot of people who don't like it, I believe it's one of those shows, your going to fall absolutely head over heels in love with, or you just won't get it at all. If you cherish how special and amusing every day life is, then you must watch this anime!

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to listen to random conversations in an anime? And what would happen if this would make up the majority of said anime? Combined with goofy characters and a pretty loose story, Lucky Star fulfills your need for complete randomness.
Now, the first episode might scare you away, thinking that it's going to be a boring anime that focuses on trivial things. Well, it does. But as you keep watching, you'll notice that you can't stop. Why? Well, it's difficult to explain. I mean, there's no actual story other than some loose mini-stories here and there, and oftenit's just random goofing around. But why do we keep watching? Well, it's probably because this pretty much resembles the average life of a high schooler. I mean, when was the last time you were actually having a serious conversation with (high) school friends? The reason the concept of this anime works is because it subconsciously reminds us of the time we had at high school, just hanging about, talking about random stuff. And even though the subjects vary so much, it's because of the variation and the comments during their discussions what makes it a fun anime. Not to mention the cute and silly characters.


As for characters, there's a bunch of them. The most famous one is Konata Izumi, who resembles your average Otaku/MAL user (in the best way possible). She's lazy, barely sleeps, plays games, reads manga, watches anime, doesn't care about school, and has fun with friends. A perfect resemblance if you ask me, and they did a great job on her character, facial expressions and voice casting. (The English voices aren't that great though imo, sorry. Stick to Japanese)

Then, we got the Hiiragi sisters, Tsukasa and Kagami. They're twins, although they don't look the same (which is even explained in the anime, that's how random the subjects can be), and their personalities are completely different. Kagami is a serious, hard-working type that can't stand how Konata is always so carefree, whereas Tsukasa sleeps in all the time, is timid and a bit shy sometimes, and doesn't really do schoolwork that much either, kinda like Konata.

And last of our main cast, we have Miyuki, who's pretty much the cutest walking encyclopedia ever, as she knows pretty much every (trivial) thing there is. She's also a bit timid and shy like Tsukasa, and once again the voice casting for her is nicely picked, as her voice matches her personality perfectly.

We also got a whole bunch of side-characters, including Yui (Konata's cousin), Yutaka (Yui's younger sister), and many more. I won't go into these characters too much as the focus is mainly on the four characters mentioned before. I do have to admit that each side-character has their silly and funny traits, like the perverted manga artist.


The art style is simple, but really nice and cute. It goes very well with the overall feel of the anime, and they couldn't have done a better job on the expressions. The music is well... Repetitive and slightly dull-ish, but it keeps the anime well-balanced in my opinion, not making it too forced and in-your-face-cute.


And now, The Lucky Channel. I love this bit. A lot. I can barely describe how much I just love the weird stuff that goes on at the end of the anime with Akira and Minoru, how they bicker, how Akira the idol goes all old-lady all the time, how the karaoke bit at the end got replaced by Minoru IRL, how Minoru plays himself in the anime and the way he talks and acts. I don't know, it's just something I kept looking forward to when I went through each episode. It's kinda like a BD/DVD special, except that it's included with each episode. Safe to say, a lot of fun.


So in conclusion, Lucky Star is random, silly, cute, funny, interesting, odd, awkward, and many more things. I had trouble writing this review as I couldn't really find a starting point. It's not an anime to take seriously, or to really even think about. It's something you watch with your common sense turned off, as you sit there smiling and laughing about all the silly things happening in the show. It's a recommendation if you're into all that, and if not, I seriously recommend giving it a shot to see if the randomness will latch onto you. It sure did for me.

I think this series is awesome. I don't understand all the jokes but I have only been into anime for about a year now and this is an anime for otaku. Konata is basicly the best/funniest character ever created. I laugh every time I look at a picture of her. I think you need a good attention span to watch this anime though because there is a lot of talking which isn't bad but for some people I'm sure reading so much subtitles would turn them off to it.

When I think of Lucky Star, I think of brainless entertainment. 
Story: Really it isn't the story that gets the ranking of an 8, it's more the concept. Not many shows take this kind of theme. The theme is brainless, but it is entertaining. It takes conversations that we have in our daily lives and turns them into an anime, thus we have Lucky Star. What's actually funny about this series is how much people can relate their stories to real life experiences. I mean, who hasn't had a 5 minute conversation about how they eat certain foods or something along those lines? In factsince I started watching Lucky Star I've noticed myself having those kinds of conversations and I tend to laugh and think "Lucky Star moment." So Lucky Star for me has actually leaked over a bit into my life and even when I'm not watching, it has provided me with a bit of a chuckle. This just goes to show life can be entertaining if you look closely enough at it from the Lucky Star standpoint. 


Art: The art wasn't horrible, but it was a typical style. There isn't much to be said about it except the expressions during different situations made me laugh. Nothing better than anime expressions. 


Sound: To be truthful, I don't remember much about the music except for the theme song. I admit, I love the theme song. As hard as I try though, I don't really recall what the music sounds like. 


Character: I believe we all have a character we can relate to in this series, probably most of us relate to Konota more than any of them. I like each character for their own personality and it didn't seem like any one character was better than another, each had their own pros and cons.


Enjoyment: This was a good anime to wind down the day with that doesn't need much energy to enjoy. This is just what I need after a long day at school working my brain to death. It got boring at times, but overall it was an enjoyable series. Just not the kind of series for people who like a complex storyline. If you're multi-tasking or about to go to sleep and want something light hearted, Lucky Star is your anime.


Overall: I can see how people like this series and I can also see why people would dislike this series. It's not really an anime to watch for excitement, action, romance, or anything of that nature. It's more for comedy that can make you laugh out loud or put a smile on your face. Nothing more and nothing less. So key tip, don't mean to beat a dead horse, but if you're looking for complexity or a story line, you may want to look elsewhere or you'll just be wasting time.

Hey people! Here's my second review. This time I picked something very easy to review and see how it goes from now on. Anime in question is Lucky☆Star, a slapstick comedy presenting the lives of a few completely normal high school girls. Well, not that normal, but let's see further.
Lucky☆Star is one of those light-hearted anime that give you less than what you would call a story and more than what you would call laughing stocks. it's a baseless comedy that only comes to us once in a year. An anime one of a kind, with interesting characters to say the least.
Story - 6
Protagonist KonataIzumi enjoying otaku life to the fullest and teasing the -bleep- out of everyone. This is the story of Lucky☆Star, with a few good pointers here and there. Honestly though, even if you decide to watch the anime starting from episode 1-5 so that all characters are introduced and then decide to watch all other episodes backwards then you will have noticed no difference. Skipping episodes like no problem ftw! (although I wouldn't suggest doing so)



Art - 8 


Characters really representing the light mood of the anime, being basically full lolis in high school with some pretty fun expressions that make you laugh out so loud that the neighbouring town can hear you. Backgrounds are nothing amazing, just what needs to be there to make the scenes feel good.



Sound - 9


The voice acting is what deserves extreme praise here. Much variety on the voices of the characters shows the uniqueness of each one giving some form of completeness there as well. Big props to Kona-chan's seiyuu, Fukuhara Kaori, acting the voice I love so freakin much! Opening theme, "Motteke! Sailor Fuku" sung by the 4 seiyuu of the main characters is pretty catchy and definitely suits the mood. Although it gets a bit boring after 15 or so episodes so I skipped it from there on. Now comes another surprising feat that not many anime have achieved so far. Lucky☆Star has 24 ending themes. Yes you read right, twenty-four, writing that in letters as well so that I'm perfectly clear. To be honest, I haven't listened to all of them so I can't judge whether they are good, fitting, bad or whatever else you may think of. But only the variety that this brought made the anime all the more enjoyable.



Character - 9


Let's admit it, Lucky☆Star has a crapton of characters, whilst not making them the same not even a bit. Character versatility is not so key in slapstick, but it feels nice to have.


Konata Izumi - The main character of the series and definitely the funniest one out of them all. She is a hardcore otaku, raised by her father alone (a lolicon at that) who taught her all the things about being one. She has a brilliant mind which she uses to excel at games and thinking about and discussing anime. She loves playing the oh so popular in Japan MMORPG games, but also likes console gaming. Of course, you are not a proper otaku if you don't go to a manga store at least twice per week and watching anime every day, and gaming all night. She has a tendency to pick on everyone and throw out jokes every minute. She especially likes to pick on Hiiragi Kagami, despite being in different classes. Having said all that, Konata is easily one HUGE troll.


Hiiragi Kagami - The tsundere of the series, she is my favorite character because, well, she is a tsundere. The only one out of a company of 4 who is in a different class. My guess is she feels left out so that must be the reason why she is in Konata's classroom every single break of every single day. She has a twin, who is a few seconds younger, so that makes Kagami feel like an older sister, so she is responsible. In contrast to Konata's immature nature, she is very mature, studying hard and always telling Konata to do so as well, although Konata is ignoring her or teasing her as an answer. Like all characters in this anime, she has her solo moments but she makes the best moments in combination with Konata, with the latter mainly teasing her.


Hiiragi Tsukasa - Enter airhead #1, Tsukasa Hiiragi. She is the younger twin of the two, the other one being Kagami of course, and she definitely acts like it. Her character has no special traits other than the fact that she gets overexcited and worked up easily, and she is trying her best to match her sister, failing miserably at that. Being an airhead, she is a great target for Konata to make fun of and the two have great moments of fun, with Konata having the most of it.


Takara Miyuki - Airhead #2 and school prodigy, Miwiki-chan! Her nickname is Miwiki because whenever she gets asked something by Konata, she always has the right answer/advice to give. She is very intelligent, hard working and the only one with actual cleavage in the whole anime. Fact is, she gets distracted really easily by small things and can't see in front of her nose without her glasses. Since she has a very large vocabulary she serves for making good puns and great admiration material for Konata. She is the one who gets teased the least out of the 4 but when she does get teased, she gets teased hard, which brings balance to the teasing levels Konata wants to have.



Enjoyment - 10


In all honesty, this is one of the anime that will make your stomach hurt from laughing from all the jokes being thrown at you. Personally, I can't count the times I just bursted out laughing from a random joke that was thrown at a completely random place and time. I can't remember the last time I've laughed so much watching anime. The parody level is over 9000, so many refferences that you need an encyclopedia to actually understand every single one. I enjoyed this anime immensly and I have to say I'm not proud to have watched it so late in my anime watching days.



Rewatchability - 10


As with my previous review, rewatchability is added as a bonus factor that is not determinant to the overall score. So, if you wanna laugh at the jokes thrown in your face every 90 seconds, then this is definitely the anime for you. Rewatchability is really viable in this because it contains no spoilers and its basically a joke dumpster where you can laugh repeatedly. The jokes are so many that you are never going to remember every single one so rewatching it has no negative impact in your viewing pleasure whatsoever.



Overall - 9


Loved it. Adored it. Konata is the best. Kagami is boss. I recommend this anime to everyone who has the slightest sense of humour. You will not be disappointed.

to be fair, I have nothing against Funimation. However, some of the anime that they make can suck balls. I heard that people who are anime fans are addicted to this show called "Lucky Star". So, I decided to go on a website just to watch this anime and see what I think and my god, was this terrible? Actually, you know what? This anime is nothing special at all and here's the reasons why. I think the show is about a bunch of girls from school talking about stuff that makes me wanna go to sleep. All I've seen in this anime are justthese characters having random conversations while making references to manga. I also find the voices to be dreadful that I would rather listen to a dying dinosaur screaming so, it can give my ears bleed. The designs make me disgusted and the animation looks like someone did cocane. The characters in the show are pathetic and I don't see why people would call them hot. So yeah, that's what I think about Lucky Star.

Lucky Star, twas a lucky find!
Lucky star is a great anime, which was honestly the first one I watched at my own accord, but I digress ~ 
The show focusus on general situations, showing memories being made, and day to day life (hence slice of life, shocker right?)
The experience overall was excellent and honestly made me see this simple anime as something special that made me generally feel pretty good about watching it unironically!
The story is subtle and light, but the character development makes the characters of Konata, Kagami, Tsukasa and Miyuki (and the other characters of Minami, Yutaka, Patty and Hiyori) quite memorable andlovable as a whole, which honestly will make you look back fondly upon remembering the anime\n\n
If you have not watched it, do it! God wills it! Deus vult!

"LUCKY STAR IS A MASTERPIECE",
That is how i ended when i finished the series and everyone were asking me, how can you like this crap ??? and i replied, because i have a good taste for craps ;)
My first impression to lucky star was => WEAK, sorta of WTF ? or WTH ? among others,
The first episode itself is ridiculous, people focus on a mindless/useless discussion about "how is the right way to eat stuff" in the ENTIRE episode... i didn't get it... what ??? where is the story ? the plot ? well... soon i would realize i wasn't watching a normal anime...
This iswere people drop it, right in the beginning , because Lucky Star is a stupid and ridiculous show, most of the jokes doesn't fit the situation for anyone to laugh but the scenes are hilarious, it is just like if it were a contradiction to itself...in fact Lucky Star is a big contradiction against itself.


A few episodes latter i could recognize Izumi Konata as one of the best characters ever in "the entire anime history" (i love to spam this phrase) , she has charisma, charm, although being a girl, she is a little mainly, lazy and a lot of other connotative adjectives that would make her even more awesome if i kept writing about her...


By the half way of the series, my impressions on lucky had improved a lot, because i managed to realize very soon that it wasn't a series for you to take seriously, reaaaaaaly, not plot to a show, means no value to it ? Lucky Star taught me that even with a very bad or no plot at all it could manage to be fun and entertaining...


But then you'd ask... what about naruto filler ? Well...lucky star can be as bad as it, but for the record, lucky star never managed to do more than it had initially proposed, naruto in the other hand, did everything to be a great show but got watered down latter because of the fillers. This never happens to lucky star.


FILLERLESS, this one is my favorite, how can you distinguish an episode being a filler if the whole series is plotless ? Or everything is filler then ? Or just some scenes of the episode were filler ? like lucky channel for instance ? 


Lucky star contradicts itself many and many times, with extremely boring scenes at times and amazing and awesome scenes at other times...but the jokes are always crappy...and then i started to ask myself ? did they made this on purpose ?


LUCKYCHANNEL

This is one of the most annoying thing about lucky star, believe me, i was throwing stuff at my TV when it showed off at the begininng , i even thought it was a filler to take the rest of the episode's screen time... but as a big surprise, it caught my attention latter on and i was requiring it to show off every time !


So how can a show be contradictory on purpose and exhibits AMAZING scenes along with CRAPPY ones and AWFUL jokes and still manage to keep the watchers attention ALL the time ?


That is the magic of this show...Its episodes are totally random, and at times i could identify with the scenes, situations and characters (did i mention konata ?) but at others i was totally dull and thinking about how crappy those girls really are...but in a blink of an eye, the scene changes and i was back there...totally interested in it, but a few minutes latter, dull again.


A roller coaster experience ? yes, every episode is just like one, i think this is the best comparison, slow and boring climbing, and fast and amazing fall...then some loops around it self, end a nice and smooth end... all of this just in ONE EPISODE.


What happens to us when we just ride a roller coaster ? want to ride again ! of course, if you can get over with this aspect of lucky star (boring climbing, amazing fall, smooth end) you will get tons of entertaining !


Later On in the series, instead of showing some crappy anime song ending, they did the unthinkable... showing an even more crappy "live" song ending with real actors... just to show how creative this series is...and of course, didn't like in the beginning but was willing to watch it later ;)


I thought a lot about how to rate this series...mainly because it does not have plot, but four things managed to make me give the MASTERPIECE = *** = 10 rating, here it goes:


* Izumi Konata

* Episode Randomness (Filler that is worth watching)

* Hilarious Scenes (not the jokes however)

* Contradictions on purpose


Lucky Star is a prof that you can't judge an anime for its firsts couple of episodes alone, and you must give a fair chance to really enjoy them, plus, plotless animes can have some big value and of course you mustn't take it seriously, because it is bad on purpose.


This is a TRUE and VALUABLE review and opinion of MINE, don't get confused about my crappy Clannad After Story Review ;)

I am the odd one out when it comes to lucky star. I just hope none of you mind you own personal opinion of the show.
Well here we go...
Story:1- Well to be quite honest, there is no actual story. From what I could gather, girls who look like they are 7(who are actually 18) talk in ear piercing voices about things that are insignificant. That's it.
Art:7- I'll admit lucky star has a unique art style which actually looks good. It's unique and colourful as all hell.

Next episode, girl likes games. Oh boy what hilarity is gonna ensue here?\n
Nothing happens. It's like this for the rest of the series.\n
The only thing that redeemed the show was lucky channel. Which I thought was hilarious.\n
Overall:3- lucky star isn't terrible. But it isn't,'the best anime ever made'(as said by some of its fans). I probably just didn't like the genre but if you enjoyed it that's fine. I didn't like It that much.\n\n
Thank you for reading,

Lucky Star is not the type of show that particularly looked interesting to me at first glance. It’s Girly, it’s cute, and it’s certainly not my thing. The reason I started to watch the show is because of the opinions surrounding it. I’d been looking up reviews of the show and I wanted to be able to formulate an opinion of it. Another reason why I was interested in Lucky Star was curiosity. It’s sort of like how a gamer might want to play Superman 64. It’s an absolutely rubbish game, and most gamers much well know that, but as a curious gamer with apassion for the video game medium, it’s not unlikely that someone like me might want to play it anyway. I went into Lucky Star knowing that I probably wouldn’t like it, but I watched it anyway because I love anime in general and I wanted to experience Lucky Star.


Into the actual show, Lucky Star is an anime about the lives of four teenage girls. The girls just live out their everyday lives... and that’s honestly about it. Sounds, boring doesn’t it? Well, it’s not the boring everyday events themselves that make the show, but more the way the events are expressed on screen. It tries to put itself out there using its cuteness factor, different camera angles, certain animation effects and overall puts more emphasis on what seem to be just ordinary things. What we get from this is a simple, yet over the top anime that shows us that life really is stranger than fiction. Some would call this ingenious.


I think that from an art and filmmaking perspective, the show succeeds immensely, but when I look at the show realistically it seems a lot harder to find entertainment value as it should be, but overall the show was good enough to make me want to watch the entire 24 episode series, so I shouldn’t be complaining too much.


Lucky star can be a very funny show and the anime and game references and parodies I particularly enjoyed, but at the same time, the show can end up being incredibly lame, especially during the first episode. The beginning of a show is supposed to hook you in, but surprisingly, the first episode was one of the worst in the series for me which is very strange. 


Now, if you’re going to make a show with such a miniscule plot, you’d think that it would be vital to have an engaging cast of characters and a well written script. Thankfully, Lucky Star has just that. Each character has their own unique personality and ways of thinking and behaving. I won’t explain the characters personalities and traits because I feel that I would be ruining one of the most important aspects of the anime. Lucky Star focuses on character development and discovery, and learning more about these characters is good and can sometimes be funny, but there are many lame, boring, crazy or just plain stupid moments that didn’t convert as well into the lucky star formula as other moments, which sadly ruins a large portion of the show.


I personally think that the lack of males in the show could be one reason why I didn’t enjoy Lucky Star as much as I should have. People of different genders often have different lifestyles, personalities and real life issues and by introducing more males, the show’s audience would broaden and the show would be more entertaining and more popular overall.


I don’t have much else to say about Lucky Star. The animation and art is smooth, crystal clear and a joy to look at, the music, while mostly forgettable, does fit the show and it’s scenes well and, with the exclusion of a few annoying voices, the dub is well performed and fits the characters well too.


I do have to bring up one more issue though. The voices are way too high pitched and the main cast are way too small and cute. They’re supposed to be sixteen at the beginning of the show and eighteen by the series finale, but they all look and sound like they’re eight years old. I know I’m just starting to nitpick now, but it does seem out of place to me.


Summing things up, Lucky Star is... different to what I’m used to which makes it difficult for me to properly judge and rate. This one of those things that you'll either love or love to hate, and as usual with this type of thing, I'm one of the very few people who are somewhere in between. I think Luck Star deserves all of the criticism that it gets, but at the same time deserves all of its praise too. Sort of like Mirror's Edge in the gaming world, I would recommend that you experience this anime, even if it's just for the experience, and don't just watch the first crappy episode either. Watch two or three more and if you don't like it, then that's fine, but if you do like it then that's fine as well.


Overall, I thought that the show wasn’t too bad. It had plenty of bad moments but, at the same time, it had a lot of good moments too. It’s kind of embarrassing to say this but Lucky Star is a pretty good show, just not a great one, so I’m giving Lucky Star a 7.5 out of 10. Funny sometimes, and a good watch to cheer you up every now and then, but this type of anime doesn't really appeal to me much, though I do recommend it for the experience. If it’s a comedy you’re looking for then I would recommend something like Sgt. Frog more than I would Lucky Star, but wether Lucky Star deserves its popularity or not really does depend on what you think.


This show isn’t for everyone and that’s okay and sadly, it wasn’t really the type of anime for me, but despite that, I’m glad I saw Lucky Star, even if it was just for the experience. I’ve learned a lot about Japanese culture and about myself from watching the show and I’m glad I made the decision to check it out.

For those of you that have seen Azumanga Daioh, this is basically that. Pure random fun. I don't think I've laughed so hard since I had watched School Rumble, and that show nearly killed me. Let me just say that this show is like Azumanga Daioh, yet not like it at the same time. If you don't know what I mean by that, we're in the same boat. It's really hard to explain. It's got the same comedy that you'd find in Azumanga Daioh, but it makes it unique in some way.
For starters, let me just say that there is no story to this showat all. You will basically be watching 24 episodes + 1 OVA of pure randomness. There is no major plot in the show, but every episode kind of has it's own mini plot. The first episode doesn't have a mini plot. For example, the first 12 minutes is them talking about how they eat different kinds of foods, then it goes from there to eye doctors to the strangest end-of-show segment called "Lucky Channel", which, let me say, was something that I wanted to skip, but something in my mind was telling me, "Nah man, don't skip it. Maybe it'll start making sense.". In the end I had watched all 24 episodes and not one episode of Lucky Channel made any sense.


I guess the artwork was unique in it's own way. I wouldn't call the characters Chibis, but they definitely had a Chibi-like personality. As for the artwork, it varied from hand drawn backdrops to photos taken by a camera. In other words, it had a Negima!? concept artwork style.


Sound was a solid 8. Patricia was probably the most high pitch voiced characters I've ever heard in any anime. Found annoying at times, but I managed to get through it. But the greatest voice actor of all was Wendee Lee. She gave Konoka the perfect voice, and the funniest thing was that the character had an obsession with Haruhi Suzumiya. For those of you who don't know what I'm talking about, Wendee Lee is the voice actress of Haruhi Suzumiya as well.


Characters were all hilarious. Konoka, or as her fans call her, Legendary Girl A, is a complete Otaku, like me, and I found I could relate to her in more ways then one, like the fact she crams all her studying in the night before a big test. Then there's Kagami and Tsukasa. They might have complete opposite personalities and different hair, but you can definitely tell they're twins. That was the best part. One was mean and vicious, the other, as innocent as a flower. You can find that in most animes with twins. Miyuki... pretty, smart, and like the nicest person you'll ever meet. Perfect idol. Multiple other characters will capture your heart as well.


Enjoyment, solid 10. Not one episode made me stop laughing. This show was super funny, and those who liked Azumanga Daioh, you can call this Season 2 only with different characters. Watch it. I hope this has helped you.

Lucky Star was a very good anime. I couldn't give the story an outstanding score due to the fact that there really wasn't one. No matter, Lucky Star was still interesting and humorous. The jokes were good, and the subjects that were talked about were just, weird. This show is about pretty much, nothing. No storyline, no plot. Just a bunch of girls that go to a high school. Konata was my personal favorite character. She's funny, she's cool. She also cute~!  My friends all love this anime. So, if you are looking for a funny otaku, Lucky Star would be your best bet.Thank you for taking time to read this review~!

The Seinfeld of anime.
It greatly reminded me of Azumanga Daioh the first time I watched it. Great character development! It's good to see an Otaku in more of a Japanese styled comedy.

TL:DR
Lucky☆Star is 9 1/2 hours of moeblob trash from moeblob specialist task force KyoAni and because I'm a moeblob loving piece of shit I liked it.
Now here's a review longer than the rambling dialogue about which end of a chocolate cornet is the head.
You need to come into Lucky☆Star with the right idea of what to expect or you'll be disoriented and annoyed.
Lucky☆Star is self aware of what it is and who it's for.
It is packed with anime and pop culture references.
If you're a casual anime fan like myself many references will go over your head.
If you're a hardcore otaku with bodypillows of all yourfavorite loli waifus you'll get offended by the portrayal of Konata's dad, because the series takes a stab at these extremes.

But if you're a seasoned anime vet that has seen a lot of shows of the time period you'll catch a ton of references from anime and pop culture.


The more anime you watch, the more you'll enjoy Lucky☆Star.

You can return to it at any point in your anime watching "career" and be pleasantly surprised by a reference you're only catching on a second or fourth viewing.


The downside to this is that as this anime ages the references are going to feel a lot more dated.




So what is it about?

Nothing, and that's the beauty of it.

Hear me out.


Do you remember in high school that one class you hated going to because you sat between these girls that happened to be best friends, so you had to listen to them yap about random bullshit the entire time back and forth. Lucky☆Star is exactly that.


So there isn't a plot and why that's a good thing:


The show is really fast paced, jumping from scene to scene with no amount of transition shot or context clue as to where you are or what is going on now. Because of the fast paced scenario based humor, non existent plot, and easy to consume material this means that after an initial viewing of the series you can later on pull up any random episode after a long day and unwind.




A lot of the issue with Lucky☆Star is that if you tell someone to come into it  with the expectation of a sitcom, their expectations are not going to be met.


I was told going into this series that it's like Seinfeld in anime format.

That is objectively wrong, and the only similarities between the shows are rewatchability and that they are both based around character driven comedy. edit: also that both main themes have bass riffs that fucking slap.


Seinfeld is a series of episodic plots with a conflict spanning the length of the episode that is resolved at the end. There is little to no plot in Lucky☆Star and thus no conflict to be resolved. The closest there ever comes to being a conflict is an argument between two sisters that is resolved in a matter of minutes.


I think this series is something you need to at least view 5 episodes of before you make your decision whether it's worth your time or not. Initially I didn't understand the appeal, but the more I watched, the more I felt the pulse of the show and was able to enjoy it.




This would not work without the right characters, so getting the girls right is important for an anime about nothing.


The characters are a group of friends just going about their lives and their dynamic is where the comedy in the show comes from; Often by trying to one up each other or out snark one another. It makes for some interesting running gags and the characters get better at making up comebacks as the series goes on. Some jokes are overused and if you're watching it all in one sitting they will get old. 


The end segment Lucky Channel features an idol who is frustrated because of her small part and angry that her career is leading her to washing out. This makes for some fun interactions between her and her fresh faced assistant ready to break into the industry.





My biggest gripes with the series are the art and the sound.


The art style is really watered down to the point that the characters are fabricated solely to be moeblobs. The backgrounds are lackluster and often not even present, and the "world" is often filled with literal blobs to serve as a proxy for background characters. And too often the camera is placed in a shot in such a way that lip flaps or walk cycles don't need to be animated, it's really obvious when you see it and you won't be able to unsee it when you notice it. But all in all the art style grew on me.


The sound can be good or bad depending on the episode. I found that sometimes the background music overpowered some of the dialogue between characters. I think the English dub for this anime is actually pretty good. Konata's VA especially.




I enjoyed Lucky☆Star a lot and I can understand where all the love and hate for it comes from, but I'm moeblob loving trash and I'm biased towards KyoAni because they made one of my favorite series of all time so your mileage may vary.

Lucky Star is a Comedy Slice of Life anime which follows a small group of 17 years old school-girls in their last year of high-school. The show consists of 24 episodes and has no ongoing story-line. Episodes are mostly divided into 3 parts, which are vaguely connected.
Story: The plot mainly portraits the daily adventures of the 4 protagonists in a comedic, lighthearted way. We follow them threw their last year of high-school, where they encounter 'typical' teenage girls problems, like which side of a chocolate cornet bread is the top and which the bottom :D
Here and there the show throws in some drama elements bypicking up topics like first love, frienship or growing up but always resolves them in a absurd or funny way, so the mood never becomes too serious. 


Characters: Lucky Star has a GREAT cast consisting of the 4 main characters (Konata, Tsukasa, Kagams and Miyuki) and several side characters.

Konata Izumi: Konata is a hardcore otaku gamer girl who hates to do schoolwork and much rather likes to spend the whole night infront of her computer, playing mmorpgs or reading Mangas, although when it comes to finishing her schoolwork or learning for a test, she is great at pulling allnighters and she almost always gets acceptable results in school.


Tsukasa Hiiragi: Tsukasa never fails to entertain the audience with her lighthearted and naive nature. She is very clumsy and often apears to be more like a child than a highschooler, her biggest weakness though is mostlikely school. She is bad at basicly any subject. Her biggest strengths are housework and cooking and it is her biggest dream to be a good wife and mother some day.


Kagami Hiiragi: Kagami is Tsukasas Twin sister. In contrast to her sister, Kagami is very good at school and sport and has a very competetive mindset. Despite being so different, the two twin sisters get along very well and rely on each other alot of the times.


Miyuki Takara: Miyuki is the smartest girl in the class. She has by far the least screentime since she often goes home instantly after school to study, when Konata and the others still hang out together and have fun.


Animations: The character design is superb, the characters are perfectly cute eye-candy! The artstyle is very minimalistic and oftentimes the backgrounds have very little to no details. I guess most people won't like this kind of minimalistic style, but for me it wasnt much of a problem at all.

Luckily the animations are very fluent, so no negative point there. 


Soundtrack: The Luckystar opening must be one of the coolest in anime-history. It is in almost all my lists on my Ipod and it never gets boring. The melody is catchy and if your not carefull your gonna be humming the melody all day long befor you even notice :P 


Conclusion: I would DEFINATLY not recommend this show for everyone!! If you are looking for a thrilling story and Shaya-Malan-style twists, your gona get REALY bored and frustraded with this show realy fast. To test if you like Lucky Star, just watch the opening scene, because it basicly sets the ton for  the rest of the show.  I pesonally love this show. After having seen over 200 different Anime from all genres, it still is on top of my list!!!  The reason for this is simple: Lucky Star is the only show i have seen (so far) where i have NOTHING to criticise. NOT the great story or animations or smart plottwists makes this my favorit Anime , but the absence of flaws. I personaly enjoyed EVERY second of this masterpiece and i wouldnt wanna miss this experience...so GO watch it!!!!

really liked it (tho i didn't get some of the jokes), but idiots who called this boring don't know what real slice of life should be like, although i do get where they are coming from since a lot of the best jokes where inside jokes whit the otaku community of the time. either way the reason i liked it was simply because it didn't have a plot and that it where just a lot of scenes out of the "daily" (cause we all know it isn't like this) life of high school girls, I especially liked the endings in the latter part of theshow... :3 man those where good

Now this is one for all you Slice of life fans and also those of you who liked Azumanga Daioh. In my opinion Lucky Star is the ultimate Slice of Life anime and if you're only into dub this show might be a problem seen as they have failed to release the last 4 episodes in dub (not a clue why, if you know message me I’d be interested to find out).
Story - Wait there’s a story line to this? afraid not, but that’s what makes this show so funny, heck the first episode they spend most of it talking about how they eat certainfoods and trust me, as dull as that sounds you will LOVE it. Each episode has nothing to do with the last and nothing to do with the next, it’s just one random thing after another. Even the previews of the next episode have nothing to do with the show itself.


Art - This is probably the worst thing about lucky star and they've done it so bad its good, now the main characters are all really well drawn, better than most shows I might add, but if you’re just a background character who plays no real part than that means you’re a blue human shaped blob nothing more...


Sound - there are so many sound effects in this show and they're all well timed and placed so no problem there in the least, and the reason this is a 9 and not an 8 is because at the end of every episode there is always a new end tune...usually taken from another anime with the cast singing it.


Character - well this section is going to basically be dedicated to Konata Izumi for her amazing ability to be an anime character who's OTAKU!! Yes you heard me right she's otaku loves anime, manga, computer games all that stuff


Enjoyment/Overall -  In every episode wether it Konata, someone else or just a few items in the background there are constant references to other animes so if you've seen more than your fair share of animes than watch Lucky star and try to spot where your favourite animes are talked about/shown. This is another must see, and it has my golden seal of approval!!

Ah, lucky star. The story line..... there IS no set story line. it`s just about Konata`s life at high school. with alot of randomness. But, you gotta love it. I watched the anime, so not alot of detail, but all the girls are cutely drawn. sound was good, I like the background music the best =D The charaters were the best! They each displayed all the sterotypes. Moe, Cute girl, gamer, hard worker ect. Gotta love it. I really enjoyed this anime, and I would give it an overall of 10. So go watch it now!!!

First of all I was very sceptic about this show, before I watched it.
I thought is was only a show for girls and crazy otakus,but I was wrong.
Experience:
Lucky Star is a slice of life and comedy anime ,which also contains japanese and otaku culture .
This show has much and fast Dialog’s
I can read fast but some scenes were evenn too fast for me ,so this show is nothing for Anime beginners who need subtitles.
I watched all episodes of Lucky Star in four days.
We follow the main character Konata and her three friends Kagami,Tsukasa and Miyuki in her daily life.
Most of the time we see themin school,or when they study at home.

The characters are acting realistic and the friendship beetween them is authentic.


The scenes in the breaks at school are a little bit boring sometimes.

The best scenes are these,when we see the girls in their freetime.

Konata’s shopping experiences are always funny.

We follow the girls to the beach,to some cultural festivals and to the comiket.


After the story part we see Lucky Channel with the Navigator Akari chan and her assistant Minoru Shiraishi.

In this part they should show us some infos about the show and the characters,but everytime Akari messed it up with her bad behavior.

She’s a mean and spoiled brat who tortures her assisant every time.

If assistant Minoru Shiraishi says the wrong things Akira gets angry at him.


The endings of the show are always different.

In the first half of this show,we see the door of an Karaoke room where the girls talking and singing  popular Anime or japanese Songs.

The Best part for me was in epiode 5.

In the second half the voice actor of Akari-chan’s assistant sings the ending songs,more wrong than right, but its funny,best part of that was in episode 14, I laughed so hard.


Conclusion:

Well, in ths show it doesn’t happen a lot,we follow the girls through 2 years of their life.

They are talking much about these and that.

The Topics are mainly school, studying,anime, games,otaku and japanese culture.


The comedy plays big part in Lucky Star ,itcontains slapstic and sometimes even some kind of adult humor.


Lucky star uses much references to other anime shows.

You should at least have watched The Melancholy of Suzumia Haruhi and Full Metal Panic to get most of the jokes.


The opening theme is great, its fast and very energetic.


The animation is simple but nice to watch.

We have always the same perspectives ,so we dont see the legs of the girls very often.

When you see the girls without legs they seem very small in height.


Cons:

No character development

Nothing special happens

You need a lot of otaku knowledge to understand all the jokes


Pros:

Characters

Lucky Channel

Opening

Cute girls

Comedy

If you were to walk into a high school and find a random group of girls whom are friends and follow their lives around with a camera, this anime would be that representation. Compared to other anime it should not be well reguarded as a work of epic plot nor captivating art and music quality; however it is still comfortable to sit down and watch. Comedy is definately the hardest to write of all the literary genres and this anime does make you chuckle from time to time. It is comparable to American cartoons in that it takes our unfortunately ordinary lives and tries toadd humor and wit by satirizing common pop culture and everyday things we complicate. It also takes advantage of many different regularly used character stereotypes and one character does not stand out too much further than the rest. It's simplistic and great for those who like shoujo, slice of life, or comedy; and for sitting down and being amused for half an hour without having much to expect nor bewilderment for your mind.

This anime is a very funny, eccentric, fun show that will please everyone. 
Every episode begins with the opening "Mottekei Sailor Fuku" which will get you dancing in your seat. Not once did I skip this opening. Everyone will love this opening and will not soon forget it. 
The show goes on with many random things such as discussing how to eat a chocolate cornet, visiting each others house, or dozing off at school.
The four main characters will surely please you. 
Konata Izumi "The leader of the characters" is an otaku that does not have very good grades and often pulls all night cram-sessions. Shewill delight you.\n
Kagami Hiiragi is a tsundere, persay, and is always in a different class than the others. She will definitely surprise you. Often called Kagamin.\n
Tsukasa Hiiragi is a very strange younger fraternal twin to Kagami, who often forgets important things.\n
Miyuki Takara is a rich, smart girl whom I wonder about. She often visits the dentist and hates it.\n\n
I recommend this show for people who love comedy and slice of life.

Lucky Star is a REALLY great anime. Great characters, great comedy, great art, great everything. Even the DUB is good! 
Story: A story of highschool girls that talk about mostly food. Also alot about anime, manga, and other simple things. Sounds nice, but not great. But, even with a very simple plot, it is actually VERY great! :D
Art: The art style is very unique, and I simply LOVE it! Very nice.
Sound: The music is very nice. The ending themes have much more then usual animes work put into it because each ending has a different song.
Characters: I loved the characters! An otaku, a tsundere, anairhead, and a smart airhead. PERFECT. X3\n\n
Enjoyment: I loved this anime, and I very much reccomend it! :D

This is going to be hard. Lucky Stay is one of those comical shows that can go in every direction. Sometimes it’s a sit down and talk show and sometimes it’s an otaku love show. Let’s see, if you like random shit in your moe pie then you would really like this.
Now that I have said this, I do have to say that I am one of those people… I actually like this show a lot. It doesn’t try to be something its not, so many shows try to be something else. This show, well… it just is. Here is an example, the very firstshow, they spend 7 minutes talking about different food and how they like to eat it. They don’t even explain the main characters, they just thrust you in. The characters are mostly 2 dimensional, though sometimes they do show little 3D characteristics. 


I think the best way to explain why there is no story if I talk about the characters and the manga. First off, the manga is actually all about a 4 panel joke base much like our own comics in the newspaper. Because of this, they have a limited time to get a point across. Even then, most of the Japanese jokes may go straight over people’s heads if they don’t know any of the otaku life. 


Now, the characters… Konata Izumi is the bona-fide otaku. She loves anything anime and even plays a couple dating sims along side her father. She may be good at sports but she would rather watch anime then be in a club. Kagami Hiirragi is a rather interesting character, acting rather tomboyish and crude but in the end, has a sweet side to her especially for her twin sister. Tsukasa Hiiragi is the younger twin that is rather clumsy and ditsy. The last one I will talk about is Miyuki Takara who is pretty much a moe girl with big breasts and cute glasses. She is clumsy but rather smart.


When the other characters come on, it just seemed like they rushed to add more characters. You see some more then others like Kanata’s little cousin. The others just seem to be pushed off to the side, and don’t get much screen time. 


The artwork is very childish and bright. Although it’s like that, it’s very clean with characters going into chibi faces and sometimes they miss shape the face but its normal for comic shows. For something done by Kyoto Animation, the creators of Air and Clannad, this is way lacking but yet, I feel if it was anything like those shows that it would probably be off a bit. The endings both seem a little out of place, the live action a lot more then the other. 


The voices are pretty fun, the English and Japanese actually sound very similar and that can be good and bad. Some characters sound really high pitched and really harsh on the ears. I like how the characters are mostly voiced by seasoned veterians which adds to the Otaku fandom even more as if you watch anime at all in the English dub, you have at least heard one of the many star voice actors here. The only voice I didn’t like was Patty’s. She just sounds like she’s forcing her voice. All in all, this is much like Azumanga Daioh.

Lucky Star is largely like a inside joke. It might be funny but only to you and people who understand it. Lucky Star feels like a bad sitcom in like every sense of the word. Its slow,boring and it lacks character in most respects.
One of the things people always say is the pop culture references in this show are great. I watched a fair bit and found that they weren't good references. They just were like flop one liners that only amateur comedians might enjoy. I remember there was like 6 minute bit about how they eat a chocolate pastry from top or bottom, itliterally had no punch line it was like a low energy disagreement that just ended eventually.


There is no story to lucky star, its just people talking for a lot of episodes.


Sound and Animation is just alright, nothing is wrong with it in any real respect. I mean the characters are meant to look simple and kinda be cute and the sound i just sound. The opening theme is surprisingly cute but its high energy leads you into a really boring let down of a episode.


I didn't enjoy lucky star, it felt like it was trying to mimic a sitcom but it just felt flat. I didn't laugh at any jokes and nothing happened that was in anyway interesting. The characters are boring and 1 dimensional. This shows just bad for a general audience. If you wanna know for sure watch 1 half a episode cause that's all it takes to know if you get the inside joke that is lucky star.

Lucky Star begins as soon as the past can be conceptualised. When dawn falls on eternity, Lucky Star emerges.
Lucky Star sounds like the pop of bubbles breaking the surface tension of conversation. Lucky Star is the truest expression of the high school experience. Lucky Star talks about the newest parts of the past because big minds in small spaces know that there is no such thing as nothing to talk about. Lucky Star talks about what's been on TV lately because that's what you did with the people in high school that maybe you were pretty good acquaintances with but hey it's not like they'reyour best friend; although Konata and Kagami will probably stay in touch.


Lucky Star knows she is a fiction.  Genre is observed and discussed. Then, it is knowingly performed anyway. The characters play at being generic. It's only when you reach the end that you realise there was very little generic about them.


Lucky Star is not for the Cowboy Bebop set. Lucky Star is not Azumanga Daioh. The pedophile is not a caricature. There is nothing respectable about Lucky Star, but Lucky Star is everything respectable about life.


Lucky Star is a big fan of Kyoto Animation. If you like Lucky Star, you will be too.


Lucky Star would rather be in her sailor suit because sailor suits just look better. Lucky Star doesn't mess with rituals.


Lucky Star is not ambrosia. Lucky Star is a chocolate cornet. Lucky Star is a picnic break at the beginning, middle, and end of a long hike. Lucky Star has no transitions and no conventional rewards.


Lucky Star ends where it began. Lucky Star is the only immutable narrative of human life. Lucky Star traces the colors of the sky all the way to the dance routine at the end of the universe. The world ends with Lucky Star.

To those looking to view Lucky Star solely for its commedy: don't. 
Lucky Star is pretty much 480 minutes of "Ayy, same lol". The series simultaneously makes fun of but undeniably loves the inspiration for its material, Japanese otaku culture. Anyone who's watched a decent amount of anime will often relate to the main character, Konata, and the other main characters, particularly Kagami, will remind you of any conversations you might have had with a friend who doesn't have the same interests you have. This relatability is the series' strong point. 
Pacing is certainly very, very slow, given the absence of a plot. I'm nottoo familiar with the whole source material behind the anime, but I believe it's structured as a four-panel strip. Similarly, Lucky Star's structure primarily depends on a series of chronological skits. The overarching plot is simply there to provide a general backbone for the story.


The art is absolutely gorgeous. CG was almost nonexistent as far as I could tell. Backgrounds had a hand-drawn aesthetic, and I felt that there was a lot of love put into the art for Lucky Star. Although background characters often just end up as blurry gray silhouettes, I loved the refusal to compromise and utilize more CG. I've noticed that there's a lot of criticism surrounding the "lolicon" character design to pander to otakus, and while that's somewhat true, the overall consistent aesthetic and the almost chibi-like proportions made the anime feel like it had its own unique art style rather than pandering with heavy amounts of moe (i.e. Gakkou Gurashi). Character designs were very cute and did not ring my bullshit alarm like other shows.


Regarding characters, characters were admittedly one-dimensional. I felt like stereotypes were heavily used (Konata the otaku, Patty the foreign otaku, lecherous father, clumsy moe Miyuki, etc.) but given the nature of the anime and the good execution of each character, I felt that each character was extremely likable. Nearing the end of the anime, I truly felt regret that it was coming to an end; there's also some surprisingly tender moments assuming that you're at least somewhat invested in the characters.


Although I did end up taking four months to finally finish the damn anime, it was genuinely enjoyable while it lasted. The endings were all unique, and the sketches before each ending all added another layer of self-aware humor.


Honestly, Lucky Star is a SoL through and through. If you like slice of life, Lucky Star serves as an excellent SoL and comedy. If you can't stand the genre however, Lucky Star will likely have poor pacing and lack of humor for you. That being said, I can wholeheartedly recommend Lucky Star as a must-see for anyone who enjoys watching anime.
